geometry.planar

Class Line

  • java.lang.Object
    • geometry.planar.Line
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<Line>

    public class Line
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable<Line>, java.io.Serializable
    Implements functionality for lines in the plane.
    Version:
    $Id: $Id
    Author:
    Alfons Wirtz
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      creates a directed Line from four integer Coordinates
      Line(Point p_a, Direction p_dir)
      creates a directed Line from a Point and a Direction
      Line(Point p_a, Point p_b)
      creates a directed Line from two Points

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int compareTo(Line p_other)
      A line l_1 is defined bigger than a line l_2, if the direction of l_1 is bigger than the direction of l_2.
      double cos_angle(Line p_other)
      calculates the cosinus of the angle between this line and p_other
      Direction direction()
      get the direction of this directed line
      boolean equals(java.lang.Object p_ob)
      returns true, if this and p_ob define the same line
      boolean fast_equals(Line p_other)
      Returns true, if this and p_other define the same line.
      double function_in_y_value_approx(double p_y)
      Calculates an approximation of the function value in y of this line at p_y, if the line is not horizontal.
      double function_value_approx(double p_x)
      Calculates an approximation of the function value of this line at p_x, if the line is not vertical.
      static Line get_instance(Point p_a, Direction p_dir)
      create a directed line from an IntPoint and an IntDirection
      FloatPoint intersection_approx(Line p_other)
      Returns an approximation of the intersection of the 2 lines by a FloatPoint.
      Point intersection(Line p_other)
      Returns the intersection point of the 2 lines.
      boolean is_diagonal()
      returns true, if this line is diagonal
      boolean is_equal_or_opposite(Line p_other)
      returns true, if this and p_ob define the same line
      boolean is_multiple_of_45_degree()
      returns true, if the direction of this line is a multiple of 45 degree
      boolean is_on_the_left(TileShape p_tile)
      Looks, if all interiour points of p_tile are on the right side of this line.
      boolean is_on_the_right(TileShape p_tile)
      Looks, if all interiour points of p_tile are on the left side of this line.
      boolean is_orthogonal()
      returns true, if the line is axis_parallel
      boolean is_parallel(Line p_other)
      checks, if this Line and p_other are parallel
      boolean is_perpendicular(Line p_other)
      checks, if this Line and p_other are perpendicular
      Line mirror_horizontal(IntPoint p_pole)
      Mirrors this line at the horizontal line through p_pole
      Line mirror_vertical(IntPoint p_pole)
      Mirrors this line at the vertical line through p_pole
      Line opposite()
      Returns the line defining the same set of points, but with opposite direction
      boolean overlaps(Line p_other)
      returns true, if the 2 lines defins the same set of points, but may have opposite directions
      Direction perpendicular_direction(Point p_from_point)
      Calculates the direction from p_from_point to the nearest point on this line to p_fro_point.
      Point perpendicular_projection(Point p_point)
      returns the perpendicular projection of p_point onto this line
      Side side_of_intersection(Line p_1, Line p_2)
      Returns Side.ON_THE_LEFT, if this line is on the left of the intersection of p_1 and p_2, Side.ON_THE_RIGHT, if this line is on the right of the intersection, and Side.COLLINEAR, if all 3 lines intersect in exacly 1 point.
      Side side_of(FloatPoint p_point)
      returns Side.ON_THE_LEFT, if this line is on the left of p_point, Side.ON_THE_RIGHT, if this line is on the right of p_point, Side.COLLINEAR otherwise.
      Side side_of(FloatPoint p_point, double p_tolerance)
      Returns Side.COLLINEAR, if p_point is on the line with tolerance p_tolerance.
      Side side_of(Point p_point)
      The function returns Side.ON_THE_LEFT, if this Line is on the left of p_point, Side.ON_THE_RIGHT, if this Line is on the right of p_point and Side.COLLINEAR, if this Line contains p_point.
      double signed_distance(FloatPoint p_point)
      Returns the signed distance of this line from p_point.
      Line translate_by(Vector p_vector)
      translates the line by p_vector
      Line translate(double p_dist)
      translates the line perpendicular at about p_dist.
      Line turn_90_degree(int p_factor, IntPoint p_pole)
      Turns this line by p_factor times 90 degree around p_pole.

      • fast_equals

        public final boolean fast_equals(Line p_other)
        Returns true, if this and p_other define the same line. Is designed for good performance, but works only for lines consisting of IntPoints.
        Parameters:
        p_other - a Line object.
        Returns:
        a boolean.

      • direction

        public Direction direction()
        get the direction of this directed line
        Returns:
        a Direction object.

      • side_of

        public Side side_of(Point p_point)
        The function returns Side.ON_THE_LEFT, if this Line is on the left of p_point, Side.ON_THE_RIGHT, if this Line is on the right of p_point and Side.COLLINEAR, if this Line contains p_point.
        Parameters:
        p_point - a Point object.
        Returns:
        a Side object.

      • side_of

        public Side side_of(FloatPoint p_point,
                    double p_tolerance)
        Returns Side.COLLINEAR, if p_point is on the line with tolerance p_tolerance. Otherwise Side.ON_THE_LEFT, if this line is on the left of p_point, or Side.ON_THE_RIGHT, if this line is on the right of p_point,
        Parameters:
        p_point - a FloatPoint object.
        p_tolerance - a double.
        Returns:
        a Side object.

      • side_of

        public Side side_of(FloatPoint p_point)
        returns Side.ON_THE_LEFT, if this line is on the left of p_point, Side.ON_THE_RIGHT, if this line is on the right of p_point, Side.COLLINEAR otherwise.
        Parameters:
        p_point - a FloatPoint object.
        Returns:
        a Side object.

      • side_of_intersection

        public Side side_of_intersection(Line p_1,
                                 Line p_2)
        Returns Side.ON_THE_LEFT, if this line is on the left of the intersection of p_1 and p_2, Side.ON_THE_RIGHT, if this line is on the right of the intersection, and Side.COLLINEAR, if all 3 lines intersect in exacly 1 point.
        Parameters:
        p_1 - a Line object.
        p_2 - a Line object.
        Returns:
        a Side object.

        Returns:
        a boolean.

      • signed_distance

        public double signed_distance(FloatPoint p_point)
        Returns the signed distance of this line from p_point. The result will be positive, if the line is on the left of p_point, else negative.
        Parameters:
        p_point - a FloatPoint object.
        Returns:
        a double.

      • overlaps

        public boolean overlaps(Line p_other)
        returns true, if the 2 lines defins the same set of points, but may have opposite directions
        Parameters:
        p_other - a Line object.
        Returns:
        a boolean.

      • opposite

        public Line opposite()
        Returns the line defining the same set of points, but with opposite direction
        Returns:
        a Line object.

      • intersection

        public Point intersection(Line p_other)
        Returns the intersection point of the 2 lines. If the lines are parallel result.is_infinite() will be true.
        Parameters:
        p_other - a Line object.
        Returns:
        a Point object.

      • intersection_approx

        public FloatPoint intersection_approx(Line p_other)
        Returns an approximation of the intersection of the 2 lines by a FloatPoint. If the lines are parallel the result coordinates will be Integer.MAX_VALUE. Useful in situations ehere performance is more important than accuracy.
        Parameters:
        p_other - a Line object.
        Returns:
        a FloatPoint object.

      • perpendicular_projection

        public Point perpendicular_projection(Point p_point)
        returns the perpendicular projection of p_point onto this line
        Parameters:
        p_point - a Point object.
        Returns:
        a Point object.

      • translate

        public Line translate(double p_dist)
        translates the line perpendicular at about p_dist. If p_dist > 0, the line will be translated to the left, else to the right
        Parameters:
        p_dist - a double.
        Returns:
        a Line object.

      • compareTo

        public int compareTo(Line p_other)
        A line l_1 is defined bigger than a line l_2, if the direction of l_1 is bigger than the direction of l_2. Implements the comparable interface. Throws a cast exception, if p_other is not a Line. Fast implementation only for lines consisting of IntPoints because of critical performance
        Specified by:
        compareTo in interface java.lang.Comparable<Line>
        Parameters:
        p_other - a Line object.
        Returns:
        a int.

      • function_value_approx

        public double function_value_approx(double p_x)
        Calculates an approximation of the function value of this line at p_x, if the line is not vertical.
        Parameters:
        p_x - a double.
        Returns:
        a double.

      • function_in_y_value_approx

        public double function_in_y_value_approx(double p_y)
        Calculates an approximation of the function value in y of this line at p_y, if the line is not horizontal.
        Parameters:
        p_y - a double.
        Returns:
        a double.

      • perpendicular_direction

        public Direction perpendicular_direction(Point p_from_point)
        Calculates the direction from p_from_point to the nearest point on this line to p_fro_point. Returns null, if p_from_point is contained in this line.
        Parameters:
        p_from_point - a Point object.
        Returns:
        a Direction object.

      • turn_90_degree

        public Line turn_90_degree(int p_factor,
                           IntPoint p_pole)
        Turns this line by p_factor times 90 degree around p_pole.
        Parameters:
        p_factor - a int.
        p_pole - a IntPoint object.
        Returns:
        a Line object.
